content:
So, I propose that we

  • cancel design meeting tomorrow, as we did not have a topic
  • schedule lang-team#18 ("const eval skill-tree") next week on June 24 (cc @RalfJ, @oli, @ecstatic-morse )
  • tentatively schedule lang-team#25 ("review WF checks and aliases") for July 1st

Did you want to have a meeting to talk about the safe-transmute stuff, @Josh Triplett, or would an async update suffice for that
I updated the calendar and posted notes on the relevant issues, but feel free to mention if that doesn't work for y'all, or to open other proposals that seem like higher priority
oh I thought const eval skill tree was today
I'll leave it up to @Ryan Levick what day works for him.
@oli would July 1 work for you? I hadn't realized that @Josh Triplett had arranged something with @Ryan Levick. Also, we should file an issue for that meeting.
@Josh Triplett @nikomatsakis I am available next week to meet. I definitely think this warrants an in person meeting as I’ve not been able to arrive at a design that fulfills all requirements
OK, @Ryan Levick, can you file a design meeting proposal issue with some notes? I just linked you to the template, it's on the rust-lang/lang-team repository.
Or just file a placeholder issue for now :) but it's useful to maybe have some background reading or other notes for folks if you want
I figure if you file it, you can edit it later
Yes I can. There’s lots of background to this issue
Yeah, I'm sure, and you don't necessarily have to provide that all in the issue, though if you are able to, that's great
I wrote down top level thoughts here: https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/26
@Ryan Levick So it seems like July 1st doesn't work well for @RalfJ to do the const-eval meeting, would July 1 be ok for you, @Ryan Levick ?
OK, I've adjusted all the invites accordingly.
